page.title: 09Our Lady Queen of Martyrs.
page.content: 1s There was in 1651 a Mission Church at Newhouse. George and Edward Smythe gave money and provided the priests with lodging and food for 1 horse and 2 cows and Â£10 a year. Father Milburn is our present priest and he was ordained in 1953. There were many predecessors such as - Rev. John Barlow who left Northumberland to come to Newhouse in 1731 and then went to Stella in Blaydon once a month to supply there. In 1736 he went back to Lanchashire. Rev. Robert Carnaby in 1729 was visited by Bishop Williams and he confirmed 31 people. He left Newhouse but returned in 1736 and died in 1745. His home was set on fire by a cat removing some linen from a clothes -horse. Father R. Gibbons was ar Newhouse from 1937 to his death in 1978.
